page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY OF FORFAR
page.content: Another of the local{monuments}is { {Balmashanner}and is known in Forfar as 'Bummy'.It was built for all the soldiers from Forfar who fell in World War 1.Every year on Remembrance Day, old soldiers and relations of ones who died go to Bummy to lay wreaths and remember their loved ones. Just about 100 metres away from the monument is a small gulley. During World War 2 a British Spitfire was chasing a German bomber. The bomb in the German plane was slowing it down so the Germans dropped it in the gulley to get away.That is the only bomb to have dropped on Forfar in the whole war.It didn't hurt anybody!
